topics.title: Module overview,
topics.objectives: A look at the context for this module.

los.title: Overview.
los.objectives: The context and specific technology stack for this module.

topics.title: JavaScript Fundamentals,
topics.objectives: The syntax and semantics of the language for both data representation and behavior representation.

los.title: JavaScript Fundamentals.
los.objectives: The syntax and semantics of Javascript for data representation and behaviour representatio,

los.title: Lab-01_JS_Objects
los.objectives: By completing a set of small exercises, this lab helps you develop an understanding of the basic syntax and fundamental concepts of the JavaScript language, with particular emphasis on data representation.

los.title: Lab-02_JS_functions
los.objectives: This lab continues our exploration of Javascripr fundamentals, this time focusing on the behavioral side. The topics covered include function definition, method definition, and constructor functions.

los.title: Resource 1.
los.objectives: The JS code samplss referenced inthe lecture slides

topics.title: Introduction to the DOM, CSS and Bootstrap
topics.objectives: This topic provides a introduction to key front end web technologies for this module

los.title: CSS and Bootstrap
los.objectives: This topic provides an overview of Cascading Style Sheets and Bootstrap. A brief introduction to HTML5 will also be covered

los.title: The Browser
los.objectives: This talk introduces the Document Object Model (DOM) and events in the browser.

los.title: Lab-03_HTML_CSS
los.objectives: By completing this lab you will develop an understanding of the basics of HTML/CSS/Bootstrap.

los.title: Code Samples
los.objectives: The code samples referenced in the lecture slides.

topics.title: Introduction to React and Storybook.
topics.objectives: Examine the basics of React's component model, including class declaration, JSX, props, composition, iteration. Introduce the Storybook development tool.

los.title: ES6 top-up.
los.objectives: A brief look at some ES6 features necessary for dealing with the React framework.

los.title: Introduction to React and Storybook.
los.objectives: Examine the basics of React's component model, including declaration, JSX, props, composition, iteration. Introduce the Storybook development tool.

los.title: Lab-React_Basics
los.objectives: This lab guides you through the basic concepts of ReactJS by completing a series of exercises aimed at producing a set of simple UI components. Also, a first look at create-react-app tool.

los.title: Resources.
los.objectives: Two zips includes: ES6 samples and UI Description samples.

topics.title: React Component model.
topics.objectives: Explore React's component model in more detail.

los.title: React Component model.
los.objectives: A look at React's data flow patterns and lifecycle hooks.

los.title: Lab_React_Data_Flow
los.objectives: Setup the FilteredFriends applications to illustrate the basic data flow design patterns promoted by ReactJS.

los.title: Lab_Static_React_Apps
los.objectives: Over the coming weeks we will build three React apps in parallel. A static version of each is the target of this lab.

los.title: Resources.
los.objectives: The Counter example

topics.title: Thinking in React.
topics.objectives: Explain the design and development process promoted by the React designers - Thinking in React.

los.title: Thinking in React.
los.objectives: Explain the design and development process promoted by the React designers - Thinking in React.

los.title: ES6 top-up.
los.objectives: A brief look at some more ES6 features useful for cleaner JS development.

los.title: Lab-Interactive_Apps
los.objectives: Continue the development of the three SPAs by adding statefulness and making them interactive and dynamic.

los.title: Resources.
los.objectives: ES6 sample code snippets.

topics.title: React Routing.
topics.objectives: Routing (or Navigation) in a React app is implemented using a separate module, however, it is fully aligned with React's core design principles.

los.title: Routing.
los.objectives: The Router follows the principles of React core in that it promotes a declarative,programming model, using component composition and the 'event -> state change -> render' process.

los.title: Functional components.
los.objectives: Stateless components can be implemented as functions rather than classes.

los.title: Lab_React_Routing
los.objectives: In this lab we add routing to the apps being developed over the previous two lab exercises. Only the Phone Catalogue and Hacker News apps require routing logic.

los.title: Resources.
los.objectives: Routing samples..

los.title: Git Overview
los.objectives: This talk provides a brief git overview - just enought to get through the assignments and labs!

los.title: Node
los.objectives: This topic provides an introduction to Node and Express. You will cover Server-side Javascript, event-driven web servers and the Express package.

los.title: Lab-node1
los.objectives: This lab introduces node.js as a server-side technology. You will use node.js to run javascript programs on the "server-side" which are capable of servicing HTTP requests.

topics.title: Web APIs
topics.objectives: This topic explores API design and implementation using the Express web application framework.

los.title: Async Programming
los.objectives: This topic examines asynchronous programming styles using Callback functions, Promises and Async/Await.

los.title: Web APIs using Express
los.objectives: This topic explores API design and implementation using the Express web application framework.

los.title: Lab-node2
los.objectives: This lab uses Express implement APIs for the contact and Hacker News examples. In this lab you will use routing, parameterise URLs, and parsing Middleware.

topics.title: Mongo and Mongoose
topics.objectives: Mongo is a NoSQL Database. Mongoose provides elegant Mongodb object modelling in Node.js. This topic explores how to use both in Express apps.

los.title: MongoDB and Mongoose
los.objectives: This topic introduces MongoDB and Mongoose, an object modeling tool designed to work in an asynchronous environment.

los.title: Extra Video - Methods and Referencing
los.objectives: Extra material not covered in the last lecture.

los.title: Lab-node3
los.objectives: This lab introduces Mongoose, a simple way of interacting with your Mongo database.

los.title: Lab-Optional-Sessions
los.objectives: This lab improves the Hacker News API to demonstrate using methods in Mongoose to create a simple authentication middlewared function.

topics.title: Authentication using JWT and Passport
topics.objectives: This topic descibes how JSON Web Tokens and Passport.js can be used for authentication in Express web APIs.

los.title: Authentication using Express, JWT, and Passport
los.objectives: This talk descibes how Java Web Tokens and Passport.js can be used for authentication in Express web APIs.

los.title: Authentication-JWT
los.objectives: This lab implements a JWT-based Authentication strategy on the Hacker News solution from the previous lab.

los.title: Assignment1.
los.objectives: Design and develop a React SPA that demonstrates the frameworks feature set.
